summary: "The House of the Rising Sun" is a classic American folk song about someone's troubled life in New Orleans. It warns family members to avoid the same mistakes. The most popular version was recorded by The Animals in 1964, becoming a huge hit worldwide. This song is special because it's an old folk tune played by a rock band, and it's often called the first folk-rock hit. The song's history goes back to the 1930s in Appalachia, but it likely has older English folk roots.
title: The House of the Rising Sun
